text: Jack French Kemp (July 13, 1935May 2, 2009) was an American politician and a collegiate and professional football player. A Republican, he served as Housing Secretary in the administration of President George H. W. Bush from 1989 to 1993. Kemp was known for being a top adviser to President Ronald Reagan. He helped Reagan pass the Economic Recovery Tax Act of 1981. Some people say that he helped create the Reagan Revolution during the 1980s. Kemp served nine terms as a congressman for Western New York's 31st congressional district from 1971 to 1989. He was the Republican Party's nominee for Vice President in the 1996 election, where he was the running mate of presidential nominee Bob Dole. Kemp had previously contended for the presidential nomination in the 1988 Republican primaries. Kemp died of cancer of unknown primary origin in Bethesda, Maryland, aged 73. ==References== ==Other websites== * NCAA's 100 most influential student-athletes * Kemp Partners * Excerpt from October 1996 Kemp-Gore Debate * Remarks from Vice Presidential nomination acceptance * Summary of political positions from his own words * New York Times obituary * Jack Kemp at Findagrave * Obituary in the Baltimore Sun * Jack Kemp - Daily Telegraph obituary Category:1935 births Category:2009 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in Maryland Category:Deaths from cancer of unknown primary origin Category:Politicians from Los Angeles Category:Politicians from New York (state) Category:Sportspeople from Los Angeles Category:Sportspeople from New York (state) Category:United States representatives from New York (state) Category:United States Secretaries of Housing and Urban Development Category:1988 United States presidential candidates Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians
title: Jack Kemp
